description: Originated 1890–95 from Yiddish חוצפּה‎ (khutspe), from Mishnaic Hebrew חוֹצְפָּה‎ (ḥôṣǝpâ) (Sotah 9:15 in MSS Kaufmann A50), from חָצַף‎ (ḥāṣap̄, “to be insolent”). Ultimately from Aramaic חֲצִיפָא‎ (ḥăṣîp̄āʾ), חֲצַף‎ (ḥăṣap̄, “to be barefaced, insolent”).

entries.meaning: (informal) Nearly arrogant courage; utter audacity, effrontery or impudence; supreme self-confidence; exaggerated self-opinion.
examples: Synonyms: cheek, nerve, boldness, audacity, insolence
